alert.note: Alert for Wallowa County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 14 at 12:24PM PDT until March 15 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY ABOVE 3000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches above 3000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Wallowa County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow totals of 4 to 7 inches are expected above 4000 feet in upslope areas along the base of the Wallowa Mountains. Highest confidence in accumulating snowfall will begin this evening and tonight, especially in moderate to heavy snow bands.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
